omx

Class OmxFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • omx.AttributedElement
      • omx.OmxFile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class OmxFile
extends AttributedElement
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    The OmxFile class provides read and write access to OMX files.

    • Method Detail

      • getFilePath

        public java.nio.file.Path getFilePath()
        Get the path to the file this instance represents.
        Returns:
        the OMX file path.

      • getShape

        public int[] getShape()
        Get the shape (dimensionality) of the matrix data this OMX file holds. If the file does not exist, this method will return null.
        Returns:
        the shape of this file's matrix data, or null if the file does not exist.

      • openReadOnly

        public void openReadOnly()
        Open the OMX file in read-only mode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the is already opened.

      • openReadWrite

        public void openReadWrite()
        Open the OMX file in read-write mode.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file does not exist.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the is already opened.

      • openNew

        public void openNew(int[] shape)
        Open the OMX file in new mode; this will create a new file or, if one already exists, replace it.
        Parameters:
        shape - The shape of the matrix data the new OMX file will hold.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the is already opened.

      • reload

        public void reload()
        Reload the information/data held in this instance with that existing in actual file. This method should generally not be needed unless an OMX file might be modified (while in use) by and external process.

      • save

        public void save()
        Save any changes made to the OMX data held by this instance to file. Checks will be made to see if any data has changed on all OmxMatrix and OmxLookup instances provided by this OmxFile instance; if changes are detected, they will be written to the file.

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • getMatrix

        public OmxMatrix<?,?> getMatrix(java.lang.String name)
        Get the OMX matrix held in this OMX file corresponding to a specific name.
        Parameters:
        name - The matrix name.
        Returns:
        the matrix named name held by this OMX file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no matrix named name is found in this OMX file.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is not opened.

      • getMatrixNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getMatrixNames()
        Get the set of all matrix names held in this OMX file.
        Returns:
        the set of names of all matrices held in this OMX file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is not opened.

      • addMatrix

        public void addMatrix(OmxMatrix<?,?> matrix)
        Add a matrix to this OMX file, using its name as an identifier. Note that if a matrix already exists in the file with the same name, it will be overwritten by this method.
        Parameters:
        matrix - The matrix to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the file is not opened or is not opened for writable access.

      • deleteMatrix

        public void deleteMatrix(java.lang.String name)
        Delete the OMX matrix held in this OMX file corresponding to a specific name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the matrix to delete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no matrix named name is found in this OMX file.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the file is not opened or is not opened for writable access.

      • getLookup

        public OmxLookup<?,?> getLookup(java.lang.String name)
        Get the OMX lookup held in this OMX file corresponding to a specific name.
        Parameters:
        name - The lookup name.
        Returns:
        the lookup named name held by this OMX file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no lookup named name is found in this OMX file.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is not opened.

      • getLookupNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getLookupNames()
        Get the set of all lookup names held in this OMX file.
        Returns:
        the set of names of all lookups held in this OMX file.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this file is not opened.

      • addLookup

        public void addLookup(OmxLookup<?,?> lookup)
        Add a lookup to this OMX file, using its name as an identifier. Note that if a lookup already exists in the file with the same name, it will be overwritten by this method.
        Parameters:
        lookup - The lookup to add.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the lookup length does not correspond to the size of at least on of the dimensions of matrices held by this file.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the file is not opened or is not opened for writable access.

      • deleteLookup

        public void deleteLookup(java.lang.String name)
        Delete the OMX matrix held in this OMX file corresponding to a specific name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the matrix to delete.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if no matrix named name is found in this OMX file.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the file is not opened or is not opened for writable access.

      • summary

        public java.lang.String summary()
        Get a text summary of the contents of this OMX file.
        Returns:
        a summary of this OMX file's contents.

      • repack

        public static void repack(java.lang.String sourceFile,
          java.lang.String destinationFile)
        Repack this OMX file to a new file. This method is useful because deleting elements in a OMX (HDF5) file does not necessarily delete the data from the file, just the links to it. This means a file which has had data deleted from it may be larger (on disk) than necessary. This method essentially loads the file data, and the rewrites a new file with the data.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - The source OMX file.
        destinationFile - The destination OMX file.

      • repack

        public static void repack(java.nio.file.Path sourceFile,
          java.nio.file.Path destinationFile)
        Repack this OMX file to a new file. This method is useful because deleting elements in a OMX (HDF5) file does not necessarily delete the data from the file, just the links to it. This means a file which has had data deleted from it may be larger (on disk) than necessary. This method essentially loads the file data, and the rewrites a new file with the data.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - The source OMX file.
        destinationFile - The destination OMX file.

      • repack

        public static void repack(java.lang.String file)
        Repack this OMX file. This method is useful because deleting elements in a OMX (HDF5) file does not necessarily delete the data from the file, just the links to it. This means a file which has had data deleted from it may be larger (on disk) than necessary. This method essentially loads the file data, repacks it to a new temporary file, and then replaces the existing file with the newly created one.
        Parameters:
        file - The OMX file to repack.

      • repack

        public static void repack(java.nio.file.Path file)
        Repack this OMX file. This method is useful because deleting elements in a OMX (HDF5) file does not necessarily delete the data from the file, just the links to it. This means a file which has had data deleted from it may be larger (on disk) than necessary. This method essentially loads the file data, repacks it to a new temporary file, and then replaces the existing file with the newly created one.
        Parameters:
        file - The OMX file to repack.

        public static void main(java.lang.String... args)
